articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: White House press secretary Sean Spicer resigns
articles.description: The president's spokesman was reportedly unhappy with the hiring of a new communications director.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Three Israelis stabbed to death in West Bank attack
articles.description: The victims were stabbed to death in an attack on a house in a West Bank settlement.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Justine Damond shooting: Police chief Janee Harteau quits
articles.description: Minneapolis mayor says she lost confidence in the chief after officers killed an Australian woman.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Qatar emir calls for negotiations to ease Gulf boycott
articles.description: Sheikh Al Thani says "we are open to dialogue" in his first address since four neighbours cut ties.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Prince George photo marks fourth birthday
articles.description: The picture was taken at Kensington Palace at the end of June, ahead of his birthday on Saturday.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: UK to bring in drone registration
articles.description: Drone owners will also be required to pass a safety awareness test.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Linkin Park cancel North American tour after Chester Bennington death
articles.description: The tour has been cancelled following the death of singer Chester Bennington on Thursday.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: North Korea tourism: US to ban Americans from visiting
articles.description: The State Department says the ban, following the death of a US student, will be published next week.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: China holds Canadians 'for smoking marijuana'
articles.description: Officials reportedly entered a hotel room where members of a travelling equestrian show were staying.

articles.author: BBC News
articles.title: Afghan soldiers killed in US friendly-fire air strike
articles.description: The US says it will investigate the incident in Helmand, where 10 policemen were reportedly killed.
